thread.title: EU to assist PAM cyclone affected countries, Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati with tourism funding
thread.title_full: EU to assist PAM cyclone affected countries, Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati with tourism funding

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: EU to assist PAM cyclone affected countries, Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati with tourism funding
text:
EU to assist PAM cyclone affected countries, Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati with tourism funding   
Oct 16, 2015 eTN   
At a Steering Committee meeting, held at the Le Meridien Resort in Papeete, Tahiti, the Directors of the National Tourism Offices were briefed on the implementation progress of the PRTCBP project. 
PRTCBP Project Manager, Chris Cocker, told the committee that the project has completed 94 percent of its four year project activities and the remaining project outputs will be completed by the end of December. 
He said the European Union approved a special contingency fund of €180,000 to assist the cyclone PAM-affected countries, Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati with programs already approved in the PRTCBP 2015 work plan. 
SPTO Chief Executive Ilisoni Vuidreketi stated: “We would like to thank the European Union for their support towards work that the SPTO conducts in the region. This work has been vital in our bid to strengthen institutional capacity in tourism in the Pacific region.” 
“We would also like to thank the National Tourism Offices for their support towards the PRTCBP, such as through ground transfers, hotel bookings, setting up of interviews and so forth, which has enabled us to carry out our work effectively.” 
“We have built the capacity in the SPTO and we are in a good position to implement new projects in the future.'' concluded Vuidreketi.
